Reviews.Content: Best choice in Bali!!! Villa Balquisse is the most beautiful hotel we've ever been to. The staff is very helpful and friendly and the rooms are very well-decorated!! The food is lovely, the pool is perfect. We can just say one thing: If you go to Bali, go to Villa Balquisse!!!
Reviews.Author: kwast

Reviews.Content: Lovely and Tranquil Place Villa Balquisse is a lovely retreat with very stylish interior and exterior decoration, crossover between balinese and moroccon. Rooms seem a little overpriced, but are in the range of Jimbaran Boutique Hotels. The 2 pools are very nice at any time of the day. The Staff ist very friendly and helpful. We wolud always come back.The Beach is close, but only if you manage to go through the Intercontinental Hotel, which ist difficult most of the time because of their security stafff. Otherwise you have to walk 15-20 Minutes, but you are rewarded with the best beach in Bali and nice Foodstalls on the public Beach. It ist also a good place for first or last nights when flying in or out to/from Denpasar since the Airport is only 10 Minutes away and they have a free pcikup service.However, don't follow any of their recommendations of other hotels, neither in Jimbaram (when Balquisse is full) nor in any other places. We ended up in two completely ripp-offs, overpriced and shabby.
Reviews.Author: Sansibar22

Reviews.Content: The Shaba We stayed at the Shaba after seeing a review in a Travel Magazine in the UK.How glad we wereWe spent 10 days there for our 10th anniversary in June 2008.We had every intention of staying Club at the Intercontinental as we were married there.The whole ambience of the Shaba is outstanding, the rooms are huge and fitted to a high level, the outdoor areas are just breathtaking, and the personal service you get as a guest of the Shaba is wonderful. and the price is 50% cheaper than Club level at the Inter.Don't miss out on a massage, genarally a free 1/2 hour for each 3 days you stay, and don't, please don't miss out on the food. They put on a special meal for our anniverary which was truely outstanding.We did visit the intercontinental which was both crowded and a tad tired.We had a fantastic time.
Reviews.Author: RTL91

Reviews.Content: Great value - enjoyed the stay       Breakfast patio - very good
Reviews.Author: Moscow_traveller

Reviews.Content: A little gem Very spacious room at a very reasonable price.We just like the ambiance and feel of this boutique hotel.FB are very reasonably priced. Food is tasty. Service is friendly.Very interesting interior design. Ethnic chic kind of boutique hotel.Authentic Bali without the disadvantages.This is the only hotel we had that was making up our room on the last day. Finally a hotel that offer a neat room from start to finish. Bravo!
Reviews.Author: MonicaBarcelona

Reviews.Content: Beautiful Boutique Hotel This is an amazing little boutique hotel with a lot of character. Exactly what we were looking for. Charm, friendly service, reasonably priced food  beverage, good food, very interesting Interior Decoration, excellent massage (3 times cheaper than the Ritz Carlton and the massages are better at Villa Balquisse).Lots of attention to details. Beautiful spa, beautiful restaurant.An Excellent address that we warmly recommend to travellers who enjoy small hotels with character.
Reviews.Author: ornella_albani

Reviews.Content: the little things that matter and make the difference were missing The place is different (design  charm) and very quiet (we had the place to ourselves). I suppose perfect if you want to be on your own and hate big 5* hotels. The rooms of the hotel were nice but very dark. I had the impression of cash the maximum but give the minimum. We only had one small bottle of complementary water for 3 people. The maids did come and prepare the beds in the evening but didn't bother to arrange the bathroom, unlike all 5* hotels. Afternoon tea and cakes were offered. For 3 people we got 5 (1,5 cm x 1cm) pieces. The cups and tea pot were still there the following morning. Breakfast was minimalistic but good. To get to the beach you had 3 possibilities: free shuttle every 2 hours, 20 min. walk or 3 min. walk through the Hotel Intercontinental of course not allowed so we always had to pretend to be guests of Interconti. The Villa Balquisse villas however are supposed to be much nicer than the hotel rooms. I found the standard room better than the deluxe room. As a boutique hotel (also in the book Bali Chic) and if you want to compete with the big but without the facilities you just must have the little things that matter and make the difference which was not the case! We wish that we had stayed in the Hotel Intercontinental. If you want to stay in Ubud you must stay at Tegal Sari. It is great and value for money ... and we are used to staying in 5* hotels.
Reviews.Author: Kalyani

Reviews.Content: Great friendly place We stayed at Villa Balquisse this September and were very happy. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The design of the hotel was very Balinese - it seemed more like I was at a house than a hotel. The pool was charming, the room was cute, and the food at the restaurant was tastey (and reasonably priced). The Jimbaran location is ideal for exploring the southern part of the island.
Reviews.Author: plantripnow

Reviews.Content: Most Charming boutique hotel Villa Balquisse is a boutique hotel with lots of charm and character. Not the usual hotel. Charming staff, helpfull but never intrusive. Everyroom has a different theme. Mostly antique furniture, fabulous. Excellent interior decoration. Don't miss the spa for its decor and massage. The restaurant will bring you back in time with a unique atmosphere. Not far from the beach. I only paid 95USD for a room so I don't understand the average rate on this website. Great value. I fell in love with this boutique hotel. I want to go back to Bali, one reason is Villa Balquisse.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Un pur moment de bonheur       villa de reve
Reviews.Author: barcelonaparis

Reviews.Content: 銇ㄣ仸銈傘儹銉炪兂銉併儍銈仾銉淬偅銉┿仹銇?#x201d;   showReview(19155580, 'full');
Reviews.Author: lass=
